ThingDef.label: FP-45 Liberator
ThingDef.description: A very cheap concealable single-shot pistol used as aid to rebels, it short range make it unsuitable for even fighting with another handgun user.

ThingDef.label: Hand Cannon
ThingDef.description: A single shot hand cannon that is capable to fire AP ammo.

ThingDef.label: Welwyn
ThingDef.description: A bolt-action suppressed pistol, poor range, low accuracy and low rate of fire but provide a concealable weapon and a tool for instant assasination.

ThingDef.label: Walther P99
ThingDef.description: Semi-Automatic pistol made by Carl Walther GmbH Sportwaffen , use .40SW.

ThingDef.label: M1911A1
ThingDef.description: The M1911 also known as the Browning Pistol is a single-action, semi-automatic, magazine-fed, recoil-operated pistol chambered for the .45 ACP cartridge. It served as the standard-issue sidearm for the United States Armed Forces from 1911 to 1986. It was widely used in World War I, World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War as well as the Soviet–Afghan War.

ThingDef.label: Makarov
ThingDef.description: The Makarov pistol or PM (Russian: Пистолет Макарова, Pistolet Makarova, literally Makarov's Pistol) is a Russian semi-automatic pistol. Under the project leadership of Nikolay Fyodorovich Makarov, it became the Soviet Union's standard military and police side arm in 1951.

ThingDef.label: M9A1
ThingDef.description:
The Beretta M9 — officially the Pistol, Semiautomatic, 9mm, M9 — is the designation for the Beretta 92FS semi-automatic pistol by the United States Armed Forces. The M9 was adopted by the United States military as their service pistol in 1985.
The M9 won a competition in the 1980s to replace the M1911A1 as the primary sidearm of the U.S. military, beating many other contenders, and only narrowly defeating the SIG P226 for cost reasons.

ThingDef.label: P226
ThingDef.description: The SIG Sauer P226 is a full-sized, service-type pistol made by SIG Sauer. It is chambered for the 9×19mm Parabellum, .40 S&W, .357 SIG, and .22 Long Rifle. It is essentially the same basic design of the SIG Sauer P220, but developed to use higher capacity, double stack magazines in place of the single stack magazines of the P220.

ThingDef.label: STK 100
ThingDef.description: The STK 100 is a striker fired pistol developed by Rock Island Armoury as a competitor and improvement from the Glock series. It boasts a lighter frame and less cost of resources to manufacture while maintaining the same reliability and durability of it's predecessor.

ThingDef.label: STI 2011 Combat Master
ThingDef.description:
Manufactured by an American firearm company based in Georgetown, Texas. The STI 2011® are modular M1911-style semi-automatic pistols designed for competition, duty and self-defense. All firearms are designed, engineered, and handcrafted in Texas with 100% American materials and parts.
The STI 2011 Combat Master has been beautifully tuned from the original version at Taran Tactical Innovations. This particular version was used by a legendary assassin known as "Baba Yaga".

ThingDef.label: Desert Eagle
ThingDef.description: The MRI Desert Eagle is a semi-automatic handgun notable for chambering the largest centerfire cartridge of any magazine-fed, self-loading pistol. Magnum Research Inc. (MRI) designed and developed the Desert Eagle. The design was refined and the pistols were manufactured by Israel Military Industries until 1995, when MRI shifted the manufacturing contract to Saco Defense in Saco, Maine. In 1998, MRI moved manufacturing back to IMI, which later commercialized its small arms branch under the name Israel Weapon Industries.

ThingDef.label: FN Five-seven
ThingDef.description: The FN Five-seven, trademarked as the Five-seveN, is a semi-automatic pistol designed and manufactured by FN Herstal in Belgium. The pistol is named for its 5.7-mm (.224 in) bullet diameter, and the trademark capitalization style is intended to emphasize the manufacturer's initials—FN.

ThingDef.label: Glock 17
ThingDef.description:
The Glock pistol is a series of polymer-framed, short recoil-operated, locked-breech semi-automatic pistols designed and produced by Austrian Glock Ges.m.b.H.. It entered Austrian military and police service by 1982 after it was the top performer in reliability and safety tests.
Glocks are also popular firearms among civilians for recreational and competition shooting, home and self-defense, and concealed carry or open carry.

ThingDef.label: Glock 18
ThingDef.description:
The Glock pistol is a series of polymer-framed, short recoil-operated, locked-breech semi-automatic pistols designed and produced by Austrian Glock Ges.m.b.H.. It entered Austrian military and police service by 1982 after it was the top performer in reliability and safety tests.
Glocks are also popular firearms among civilians for recreational and competition shooting, home and self-defense, and concealed carry or open carry.

ThingDef.label: P320
ThingDef.description:
The SIG Sauer P320 is a modular design of semi-automatic pistol made by Sig Sauer, Inc. of Exeter, New Hampshire and SIG Sauer GmbH of Eckernförde, Germany.
On 19 January 2017, it was announced that a customized version of the SIG Sauer P320 had won the United States Army's XM17 Modular Handgun System competition.

ThingDef.label: XD-M
ThingDef.description:
The HS2000 (Hrvatski Samokres (Croatian Pistol)), or XD (X-treme Duty) are a series of semi-automatic pistol that are polymer-framed and striker-fired.
Manufactured in the city of Karlovac, Croatia by HS Produkt (formerly I.M. Metal), the Springfield Armory XD, XDM, or XD-S is the marketing name for the weapon, which is licensed and sold in the United States by Springfield Armory, Inc.
This version is chambered in .45 ACP.

ThingDef.label: USP 45
ThingDef.description:
The USP (Universelle Selbstladepistole or "universal self-loading pistol") is a semi-automatic pistol developed in Germany by Heckler and Koch GmbH (HK) of Oberndorf am Neckar as a replacement for the P7 series of handguns.
This USP version is chambered in .45 ACP.

ThingDef.label: ZevTech Glock 17
ThingDef.description: In the present day, more than 40 countries use Glock pistols on their police corps. This Glock 17 is modified with Zev Tech attachments as well as a Trijicon RMR Reflex Sight.

ThingDef.label: M9A1 (Upgraded)
ThingDef.description: Sneaky Sneaky.

ThingDef.label: Makarov Drummer
ThingDef.description: Let`s throw concealment out of the window and have the ability to shoot 80 peas at your raiders.
